message: (though my library can manually capture stderr, it would be more convenient to have tostring do the capturing)
I'll note that this would be helpful for my tester library, since it needs to capture stderr.

I think one of the best reasons to use stderr is to avoid 'tostring, so no. I just print debug information on stdout, and when 'tostring captures it I always kick myself for not using stderr. Not that I ever learn....
Maybe the library could say (tostring:w/stderr stdout ...). Is that common enough that it needs a shortcut?

tostring is used extensively in html.arc, so having tostring also capture stderr would break all the code that uses html.arc and also prints to stderr using ero or my erp.

It would be easy though to have a "errtostring" macro, if that would be adequate for your needs.
Hm... I hadn't thought of that, rocketnia. I'll see if that works, and if it does, then that would be just fine.
Having a separate macro would be fine too, but I'll try rocketnia's approach first, since I don't think it's common enough to need a macro yet.
